NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
Goals and Purposes
NOTE: CONFIDENTIAL. NOT FOR PUBLICATION
PREAMBLE - The National Association of Educational Broadcasters is
organized and operated to raise the cultural and educational level in
our American Society through broadcasting, with institutional member¬
ship and by cooperation with all educational institutions—univer¬
sities, colleges, and schools — other organizations and individuals
who have a common goal in raising the cultural and educational levels
in our society.
SERVICES - N. A. E. B. is implementing these aims and purposes by
providing services in the following areas:
1. LEADERSHIP - Provide leadership in all areas of educational
broadcasting, representing public interests, and supporting
and protecting rights of educational broadcasts in radio and
television.
2. INTERPRETATION - Interpret the role of educational radio and
television radio and television broadcasting in the modern
world.
3. PROGRAMMING - To develop, produce, and exchange quality pro¬
grams with a serious purpose.
3a. Experiment with .new program ideas and techniques.
3b. Encourage utilization of programs with a serious purpose.
4. ENCOURAGE SUPPORT - To encourage support of educational radio
and television broadcasting and its role in a modern society.
5. CONSULTANT SERVICES - To provide consultant services in
areas of management — philosophy, programming, engineer¬
ing, legal, licensing, etc.
